question.p: Make complains that fspec.pl is not executable.

answer.p: Configure is supposed to "chmod +x" this file. It appears not to the first time. Manually do the chmod if you run into this problem. (chmod +x Packages/Uintah/tools/fspec.pl)

question.p: How do I get the simulation to only run a set number of iterations instead of going to a set time?

answer.p: In the "Time" field of the .ups file, put in a "max_iterations" tag. Set the value to the number of iterations you want executed. The simulation will run that many iterations (or till maxTime, which ever comes first.)

question.p: What are the standard configure command line arguments?

answer.p: --enable-32bit or --enable-64bit: Whether to use 32 or 64 bit compilation
--enable-package=Uintah: Packages to use. You get the base PSE Core by default. C-SAFErs will almost always only need Uintah.
--enable-debug or --disable-debug: Whether you want the -g debug flag for compilation or not.
'--enable-optimize=-Ofast -G 0' Optimization flag. NOTE: Needs to be in quotes.
--enable-parallel: Only used for the prototype CCA stuff. Uintah does NOT require it and you probably shouldn't use it unless you know what you are doing.
--with-globus=/res/sci/data16/ddestger/globus_debug: Location of the globus code. Used wit the --enable-parallel command.
--with-tau=/res/sci/data1/TAU/sgin32/lib/Makefile.tau-sgitimers-sproc: Location of the TAU (performance evaluation toolkit) code.
--enable-sci-malloc or --disable-sci-malloc: Usually enable SCI malloc for debug, and disable it for optimized builds.

--with-thirdparty=/usr/projects/Uintah/SCIRun_Thirdparty_32: Where the SCIRun support code exists. The above line is good on Nirvana. On machines local to the SCI group, this flag need not be specified as configure will find the third party libs automatically for you.
